name: places/ChIJGUh9dKFYwokRM5AqwOWMS3s
adrFormatAddress: 1136 5th Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA

originalText.text: I had no complaints with my doctor service but more so the staff specifically the office manager. She stated they had attempted to reach out to me last year over 10 times for a follow up and sent a letter which I never received. Neither a call or letter or email and for that reason they can no longer have me as a patient because that is “not how they run a office”. She allowed me no time to question this obviously because I have been home all year as we have been in lockdown half of early part of year when these apparent calls were made to reach me. I have never been treated like that by any doctor’s staff in my life. I am affiliated with Mount Sinai and will insure I share this experience with any expecting mothers. Especially after having a painful loss of pregnancy which my doctor assisted with at this office last year this is now how they should treat any of their patients.

originalText.text: Incredible doctor, delivered my first child just last week and it was so smooth. Extremely committed to his patients and very knowledgeable. Appointments are short and to the point - I never had to wait. Thank you Dr. Sullum for amazing care! Highly recommend, his staff is equally amazing

Appointments are short and to the point - I never had to wait. Thank you Dr. Sullum for amazing care! Highly recommend, his staff is equally amazing

originalText.text: Dr. Sullum is a great Doctor and very nice.  He is very hands-on and takes the time to help you understand what he is doing.  Also, when you have a question and call the office, he will speak to you instead of a nurse or the office staff, which is highly unusual.   I highly recomend him.

Also, when you have a question and call the office, he will speak to you instead of a nurse or the office staff, which is highly unusual.   I highly recomend him.

originalText.text: Avoid at all cost! I have never had a painful annual exam. I've actually never had a truly painful pap smear before. Unpleasant yes, but painful, No. I was in tears. My experience with this visit was extremely painful and I know that it need not be. I was also given an unnecessary biopsy. This was also excessively painful and was done without my consent. This doctor has no idea how to communicate with his patients and is to say the very least unskilled.

originalText.text: I have been going to Dr. Sullum's office for many years.  He has always been very attentive, caring and takes my calls right away.  His staff is very knowledgeable and pleasant.  I never wait more than 10 minutes to be seen.
